intro: Sahagunia strepitans, commonly known as the hummingbird orchid, is a striking tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its vibrant, colorful flowers that resemble the wings of a hummingbird. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers emit a sweet fragrance to attract pollinators like bees and hummingbirds. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
